alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:38PM EST until December 19 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Bush Kill At Shoemakers affecting Monroe County. For the Bush Kill...including Shoemakers...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bush Kill at Shoemakers. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Route 209 in the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area floods. At 7.0 feet, Creek Road near Route 209 and Bushkill Road floods. Flooding increases on Route 209 and is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EST Monday was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.3 feet on 08/23/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Bush Kill Shoemakers 6.0 6.2 Mon 2 pm 5.3 4.3 Crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM EST.
